objects.name: message
objects.string:
Click the Shape buttons on the left to select a shape
Drag the bars below to change color and opacity
Click the empty area to start drawing the selected shape

events.comment:
This example is using the shape painter object to draw shapes
At the beginning we are creating the graphical user interface using the Shapes object which is used to select what shape to draw
We also use the shape drawer object to draw the lines on the screen that we can use to drag the BarSelect objects to select the color and opacitiy of the shape
If the mouse is first-time pressed, set canDraw to 1 as an indication we can start drawing

While the pointer is down, if the pointer is over a shape, get the sprite of the object and store it number in the shape variable which is used then to pick which shape to draw
We also set canDraw to 0 to indicate we don't want to draw just yet

In case the pointer is over the BarSelect object that means we want to drag the object to change the color of the shape, we set Drag value of the objec to 1 to indicate that we are about to drag this object
We also set the value of canDraw to 0 to indicate we don't want to draw just yet

In case the value of canDraw is 1 that means the pointer is NOT over the gui element so we can start drawing the selected shape as we move the mouse
In order to draw a shape, the drawer object going to need some initial values such as tart position of drawing, shape, shape size

The shape painter object has properties that we also need to set such as RGB color values, opacity and border. We set these values here and store them in variables for each different shape we can draw
Circle Filled
Rectangle Filled
Line
Circle Border
Rectangle Border
If the pointer is down and the bar is selected BarSelect = 1, move the bar
If the pointer is down and the value of drawing = 1 then we can start drawing

Before we can start drawing, we need to initialize some more values
In case of circle we need to set the radius
Circle Filled
Circle Border
In case of rectangle and line we need to set the end point of the shape
Rectangle Filled
Rectangle Border
Line
If the pointer is no longer down, stop drawing
Reset the counter used to pick shape number

Repeat = the size of the rectangle struct (+1 because I like the struct start with 0)
-draw the rectangle in the struct with index = i
-add 1 to i
We apply all the properties now on the drawer object based on what shape we picked to draw, what color and opacity
Draw the circle if the circle is picked shape 0 and 1
Draw the rectangle if the rectangle is picked shape: 2 and 3
Draw the line if the line is picked shape: 4
